alert.note: Alert for Norfolk; Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 18 at 9:59AM EDT until August 18 at 10:45AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT FOR EASTERN NORFOLK AND NORTHWESTERN PLYMOUTH COUNTIES... At 958 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Rockland, or near Weymouth, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Weymouth, Braintree, Marshfield, Hingham, Scituate, Rockland, Abington, Hanover, Holbrook, Norwell, and Cohasset. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
